# About

This script contains the analysis for the Cloze Prediction & Production experiment.


# Preliminaries

Libraries & co:

```{r preliminaries, message = FALSE}
rm(list = ls())
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(gridExtra)
library(Rmisc)
library(lme4)
library(lmerTest)
source("functions.R")
```


## Set flags 

Some script parameters (flags) that will determine which sections of the script will / will not be run:

```{r flags}
# Use only a subset of strong items with the minimal specified Cloze difference:
strong_item_subset <- FALSE
cloze_difference <- 0.5

# Limit how many/which plots to generate:
generate_main_plots <- FALSE
plot_inidividual_subjects <- FALSE
plot_inidividual_items<- FALSE
plot_inidividual_items_surprisal <- TRUE

# Run models:
run_models <- FALSE

# Run surprisal analyses:
run_surprisal_models<- FALSE
strong_surprisal_subset <- TRUE
```

# Subset analyses (optional)

## Strong item subset

Set `strong_item_subset = TRUE` in the flags at the top of this script to look only at the "strongest" items in terms of Cloze probability in the entire following script.

```{r subset-strong-items}
if (strong_item_subset == TRUE) {
  
  dat_strong <- dat %>% 
    dplyr::group_by(Item, ExpCondition) %>%
    dplyr::summarise(mean_cloze = mean(ClozeProb), .groups = "drop") %>% # 
    pivot_wider(names_from = ExpCondition, values_from = mean_cloze) %>% # wide format
    mutate(difference = abs(High - Low)) %>% # Calculate the absolute difference
    filter(difference >= cloze_difference) %>% # Filter items with a difference >= 0.5
    select(Item)
  
  dat_strong <- dat %>% 
    filter(Item %in% dat_strong$Item) %>% 
    select(Item, ExpCondition, ClozeProb, TargetWord) %>% 
    unique() %>% 
    arrange(Item, ExpCondition)
  
  cat("FILTERING DATA SET FOR STRONG ITEMS ONLY\n")
  
  cat("Subsetting data frame for", length(unique(dat_strong$Item)),
      "unique items with a cloze probability difference of at least",
      cloze_difference, "between conditions.")
  
  dat <- dat %>% 
    filter(Item %in% dat_strong$Item)
}
```

# RT Plots

## RTs main plot

```{r rt-line-plot, fig.height=5, fig.width=8}
# Generate a summary data frame including the SE:
dat_plot <- summarySE(dat,
                      measurevar="RT",
                      groupvars=c("Region", "ExpCondition", "Task"),
                      na.rm=T)

ggplot(data = dat_plot,
       aes(x = Region,
           y = RT,
           # color = interaction(Task, ExpCondition),
           color = ExpCondition,
           linetype = Task,
           group = ExpCondition)) +
  geom_line(linewidth = 1) +
  geom_point(size = 2, show.legend = FALSE) +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = RT - se, ymax = RT + se), 
                width = 0.2, 
                linewidth = 0.5) +
  facet_wrap(~Task) +
  xlab("Region") +
  ylab("Reading Time (ms)") +
  ggtitle("Reading Times by Task") +
  labs(color = "Expectancy") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("navy", "steelblue1")) +
  # scale_color_manual(
  #   name = "Task and Condition", # Legend title
  #   values = c("Comprehension.High" = "navy",
  #              "Comprehension.Low" = "steelblue1",
  #              "Production.High" = "seagreen4",
  #              "Production.Low" = "#8de0a4"
  #              ),
  #   labels = c("HIGH - Comprehension", "LOW - Comprehension",
  #              "HIGH - Production", "LOW - Production"),
  #   breaks = c("Comprehension.High", "Comprehension.Low",
  #              "Production.High", "Production.Low"),
  #   guide = guide_legend(override.aes = list(linetype = c(1, 1, 2, 2)))
  # ) +
  # scale_linetype_manual(values = c("Comprehension" = "solid",
  #                                  "Production" = "dashed"),
  #                       guide = FALSE) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    axis.title.x = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
    axis.title.y = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
    axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12),
    axis.text.y = element_text(size = 12),
    plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
    legend.title = element_text(size = 14),
    legend.text = element_text(size = 12),
    legend.key.width = unit(1, "cm"),
    strip.text = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA)
  )

ggsave("./plots/RTs.png", plot = last_plot(),
       width=10, height=7, dpi=320)
```

## Export individual subject plots

Generate and save one plot for each item, with the words annotated above the x-axis:

```{r subject-plots-individual}
if (plot_inidividual_subjects == TRUE) {
  dat_plot <- summarySE(dat,
                        measurevar="RT",
                        groupvars=c("Region", "ExpCondition",
                                    "Task", "UniqueID", "Subject"),
                        na.rm=T)
  
  for (i in unique(dat_plot$UniqueID)) {

    dat_plot_subj <- dat_plot %>% 
      filter(UniqueID == i)
    subj_no_char <- as.character(unique(dat_plot_subj$UniqueID))
    
    p <- ggplot(dat_plot_subj,
                aes(x = Region,

                color = ExpCondition,
                linetype = Task,

                    width = 0.2, 
                    linewidth = 0.5) +
      labs(color = "Expectancy",
           title = paste0("Reading Times: Subject ", subj_no_char)) +
      xlab("Region") +
      ylab("Reading Time (ms)") +
      theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12),
        axis.text.y = element_text(size = 12),
        plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
        legend.title = element_text(size = 14),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 12),
        strip.text = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA)
      ) +
      scale_color_manual(values = c("navy", "steelblue1"))
    
    plot_title <- paste0("./plots/subject_plots/subject_",
                         as.character(i),
                         ".png")
    ggsave(plot_title, plot = p, width=12, height=5, dpi=320)
  }
}
```

# Models

Standardize numeric predictors, set contrasts and level order for categorical predictors, etc.

```{r prepare-predictors}
dat$Expectancy <- droplevels(factor(dat$ExpCondition,
                                    levels = c("High", "Low")))
contrasts(dat$Expectancy) <- c(-0.5, 0.5)
colnames(attr(dat$Expectancy, "contrasts")) <- c("Low")  # rename factor level

dat$Task <- factor(dat$Task,
                   levels = c("Comprehension", "Production"))
contrasts(dat$Task) <- c(-0.5, 0.5)
colnames(attr(dat$Task, "contrasts")) <- c("Production")  # rename factor level

dat$Half <- factor(dat$Half, levels = c("First Half", "Second Half"))
contrasts(dat$Half) <- c(-0.5, 0.5)
colnames(attr(dat$Half, "contrasts")) <- c("Second")  # rename factor level

dat$Block <- as.factor(dat$Block)
contrasts(dat$Block) <- contr.sum(4)

dat$TaskOrder <- factor(dat$TaskOrder, levels = c("comp_prod", "prod_comp"))
contrasts(dat$TaskOrder) <- c(-0.5, 0.5)
colnames(attr(dat$TaskOrder, "contrasts")) <- c("Prod<Comp")  # rename factor level

dat$BlocksReversed <- factor(dat$BlocksReversed, levels = c("False", "True"))
contrasts(dat$BlocksReversed) <- c(-0.5, 0.5)
colnames(attr(dat$BlocksReversed, "contrasts")) <- c("True")  # rename factor level

dat$logRT <- log(dat$RT)
dat$logPreCritRT <- scale(log(dat$PreCriticalRT))
dat$Cloze_c <- scale(dat$ClozeProb)
dat$Length_c <- scale(dat$TargetLength)
dat$Freq_c <- scale(dat$TargetFreq)
dat <- dat %>% 
  mutate(WordLength = nchar(Word))
dat$TrialCounterTask_c <- scale(dat$TrialCounterTask)
dat$TrialCounterGlobal_c <- scale(dat$TrialCounterGlobal)

#TODO: residualize for word length + frequency instead?
#TODO: add precritical RT as predictor?
```


## Target word

Lmer with cloze as predictor:

```{r lmer-target-cloze, eval = FALSE}
m_target_cloze <- lmer(logRT ~ Cloze_c * Task + Length_c + Freq_c +
                   TrialCounterTask_c + logPreCritRT +
                   (1 + Cloze_c + Task + TrialCounterTask_c | Subject) +
                   (1 + Cloze_c + Task | Item),
                 data = filter(dat, Region == "target"))
summary(m_target_cloze)
```

Lmer with binary expectancy as predictor:

```{r lmer-target-binary-expectancy, eval = FALSE}
m_target <- lmer(logRT ~ Expectancy * Task + Length_c + Freq_c +
```

## Merged spillover regions model

Try model with merged spillover regions (simple su or mean).

NOTE THAT THESE MODELS WILL BE EQUIVALENT BESIDES A SLIGHT OFFSET IN THE INTERCEPT,
namely $−log(2)$, because $log(\frac{A}{B}) = log(A) - log(B)$:  
so for the mean, logRT will be $log(\frac{RTspill1 + RTspill2}{2}) = log(RTspill1 + RTspill2) - log(2)$,
while it is simply $log(RTspill1 + RTspill2)$ for the sum.  
Hence, the only difference is the constant offset $−log(2)$ for the mean, which only influences the intercept but does not impact the relationship between the predictors in the model.


```{r lmer-merged-spillover, eval = run_models}
dat_merged_spill <- dat %>%
  select(-Word, -WordPosition, -WordLength, -logRT) %>%  # Exclude the two columns
  pivot_wider(names_from = Region, values_from = RT, names_prefix = "RT")
dat_merged_spill$SumSpillRT <- ifelse(!is.na(dat_merged_spill$RTspill1) &
                                         !is.na(dat_merged_spill$RTspill2),
                                       dat_merged_spill$RTspill1 +
                                         dat_merged_spill$RTspill2,
                                       NA)
dat_merged_spill$MeanSpillRT <- dat_merged_spill$SumSpillRT / 2

dat_merged_spill$logSumSpillRT <- log(dat_merged_spill$SumSpillRT)
dat_merged_spill$logMeanSpillRT <- log(dat_merged_spill$MeanSpillRT)

m_spillover_sum <- lmer(logSumSpillRT ~ Cloze_c + Task + Cloze_c:Task +
                             Half + Half:Task +
                             Length_c + Freq_c + TrialCounterTask_c +
                             logPreCritRT +
                             (1 + Cloze_c + Task + Half | Subject) +
                             (1 | Item),
                           data = dat_merged_spill)
print(summary(m_spillover_sum))

m_spillover_mean <- lmer(logMeanSpillRT ~ Cloze_c + Task + Cloze_c:Task +
                             Half + Half:Task +
                             Length_c + Freq_c + TrialCounterTask_c +
                             logPreCritRT +
                             (1 + Cloze_c + Task + Half | Subject) +
                             (1 | Item),
                           data = dat_merged_spill)
print(summary(m_spillover_mean))
```

## Surprisal difference subset 

Subset for a set of items where surprisal in High < surprisal in Low
(or, if surprisal_difference > 1, additionally with a minimum distance between them):

```{r subset-strong-surprisal}
surprisal_difference <- 2.65  # resuls in 50-50 split between good vs. bad items
# surprisal_difference <- 1

if (strong_surprisal_subset == TRUE) {
  
  dat_strong <- dat_surprisals %>% 
    dplyr::group_by(Item, ExpCondition) %>%
    dplyr::summarise(Surprisal = mean(TargetSurprisalGptNeo), .groups = "drop") %>%
    pivot_wider(names_from = ExpCondition, values_from = Surprisal) %>% # wide format
    #mutate(difference = abs(High - Low)) %>%
    dplyr::filter(High + surprisal_difference <= Low) %>%
    dplyr::select(Item) %>%
    inner_join(dat_surprisals, by = "Item")

  dat_strong_surprisals <- dat_surprisals %>% 
    dplyr::filter(Item %in% dat_strong$Item) %>% 
    dplyr::arrange(Item, ExpCondition)
  
  cat("FILTERING DATA SET FOR STRONG ITEMS ONLY\n")
  
  cat("Subsetting data frame for", length(unique(dat_strong_surprisals$Item)),
      "unique items with a surprisal difference of at least",
      surprisal_difference, "between conditions.")
}
```

## Full stimuli correlation analysis

Transform the data frame to extract the surprisal of every word into a new column:

```{r add-surprisal-all-words}
dat_surprisals_all$WordPosition <- as.numeric(dat_surprisals_all$WordPosition)
dat_surprisals_all <- dat_surprisals_all %>% 
  rowwise() %>% 
  mutate(Gpt2Large = as.numeric(strsplit(SurprisalsGpt2Large, " ")[[1]][WordPosition])) %>%
  mutate(GptNeo = as.numeric(strsplit(SurprisalsGptNeo, " ")[[1]][WordPosition])) %>%
  mutate(Llama = as.numeric(strsplit(SurprisalsLlama, " ")[[1]][WordPosition])) %>%
  ungroup()

# Extract surprisal at each word position
apply_surprisals_positions <- function(surprisals, pos) {
    surprisal_values <- strsplit(surprisals, " ")[[1]]  # Split into vector
    as.numeric(surprisal_values[pos])  # Extract correct index
}

dat_surprisals_all <- dat_surprisals_all %>%
  mutate(Gpt2Large = mapply(apply_surprisals_positions, SurprisalsGpt2Large, WordPosition))

dat_surprisals_all <- dat_surprisals_all %>%
  mutate(GPTNeo = mapply(apply_surprisals_positions, SurprisalsGptNeo, WordPosition))

dat_surprisals_all <- dat_surprisals_all %>%
  mutate(Llama = mapply(apply_surprisals_positions, SurprisalsLlama, WordPosition))

```

Check the correlations between the surprisal measures themselves:

```{r cor-surprisals-all}
# Correlations among the surprisal values themselves (3 pairs)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$Gpt2Large,
    dat_surprisals_all$GPTNeo)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$Gpt2Large,
    dat_surprisals_all$Llama)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$GPTNeo,
    dat_surprisals_all$Llama)
```

As expected: largest similarity between gpt2-large and GPTNeo.


```{r cor-word-length-all}
cor(dat_surprisals_all$WordLength,
    dat_surprisals_all$Gpt2Large)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$WordLength,
    dat_surprisals_all$GPTNeo)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$WordLength,
    dat_surprisals_all$Llama)
```

Correlation keeps increasing!


Now the interesting bit: the correlation with RTs:

```{r cor-word-length-all}
cor(dat_surprisals_all$RT,
    dat_surprisals_all$Gpt2Large)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$RT,
    dat_surprisals_all$GPTNeo)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$RT,
    dat_surprisals_all$Llama)

dat_surprisals_all$logRT <- log(dat_surprisals_all$RT)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$logRT,
    dat_surprisals_all$Gpt2Large)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$logRT,
    dat_surprisals_all$GPTNeo)
cor(dat_surprisals_all$logRT,
    dat_surprisals_all$Llama)
```

Why are these correlation scores so low?!


### Generate a by-item RT vs. surprisal plot.

```{r item-surprisal-plots-individual}
if (plot_inidividual_items_surprisal == TRUE) {
  
  dat_plot <- summarySE(dat_surprisals_all,
                        measurevar="RT",
                        groupvars=c("Region", "ExpCondition",
                                    "Task", "Item",
                                    "WordPosition", "Word",
                                    "Gpt2Large", "GPTNeo", "Llama"),
                        na.rm=T)
  
  dat_plot$WordPosition <- as.numeric(dat_plot$WordPosition)
  summary(dat_plot$WordPosition)
  
  for (i in unique(as.numeric(as.character(dat_plot$Item)))) {
    dat_plot_item <- dat_plot %>% 
      filter(Item == i) %>% 
      group_by(WordPosition) %>%
      mutate(Word = if_else(
        WordPosition == 6,
        paste(unique(Word[WordPosition == 6]), collapse = "/"),
        Word)) %>%
      ungroup()
    item_no_char <- as.character(unique(dat_plot_item$Item))
    
    # Rescale surprisal to RTs
    dat_plot_item <- dat_plot_item %>%
      mutate(Surprisal_Gpt2Large_scaled = scales::rescale(Gpt2Large,
                                                to = range(RT, na.rm = TRUE))) %>% 
      mutate(Surprisal_GPTNeo_scaled = scales::rescale(GPTNeo,
                                             to = range(RT, na.rm = TRUE))) %>% 
      mutate(Surprisal_Llama_scaled = scales::rescale(Llama,
                                            to = range(RT, na.rm = TRUE)))
    
    dat_plot_item_long <- dat_plot_item %>%
      pivot_longer(
        cols = starts_with("Surprisal"),
        names_to = "Measure",
        values_to = "SurprisalValue"
      ) %>%
      mutate(
        Measure = recode(
          Measure,
          "Surprisal_Gpt2Large_scaled" = "GPT2-Large",
          "Surprisal_GPTNeo_scaled" = "GPTNeo",
          "Surprisal_Llama_scaled" = "Llama"
        )
      )
    
    p <- ggplot(dat_plot_item_long,
                aes(x = WordPosition)) +
      
      geom_line(aes(y = RT,
                    color = ExpCondition,
                    linetype = Task,
                    group = interaction(ExpCondition, Task)),
                linewidth = 1) +
      geom_point(aes(y = RT,
                     color = ExpCondition),
                 size = 2) +
      geom_errorbar(aes(y = RT,
                        color = ExpCondition,
                        ymin = RT - se,
                        ymax = RT + se), 
                    width = 0.2, 
                    linewidth = 0.5) +
    
      # Add scaled surprisal lines and points
      geom_line(aes(y = SurprisalValue, color = Measure),
                linewidth = 1, linetype = "solid") +
      geom_point(aes(y = SurprisalValue, color = Measure), size = 2) +

      {if (as.numeric(item_no_char) < 1000)
           annotate("rect", xmin = 5.5, xmax = 8.5, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf, 
               fill = "gray", alpha = 0.3)} +
      
      labs(color = "Measure",
           title = paste0("Reading Times: Item ", item_no_char)) +

      scale_x_continuous(
        name = "Word Position",
        breaks = dat_plot_item$WordPosition,
        sec.axis = sec_axis(~ ., name = "Word",
                            breaks = dat_plot_item$WordPosition,
                            labels = dat_plot_item$Word)
      ) +
      
      ylab("Reading Time (ms)") +
      # Secondary Y-Axis
      scale_y_continuous(sec.axis = sec_axis(~ ., name = "Scaled surprisal")) +

      # Custom color scale for the 3 surprisal measures
      scale_color_manual(values = c("GPT2-Large" = "gold",
                                    "GPTNeo" = "orange",
                                    "Llama" = "darkorange3",
                                    "High" = "navy",
                                    "Low" = "steelblue1")) +
      
      theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12),
        axis.text.y = element_text(size = 12),
        plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
        legend.title = element_text(size = 14),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 12),
        strip.text = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA)
      ) #+
      #scale_color_manual(values = c("navy", "steelblue1"))
    
    plot_title <- paste0("./plots/item_plots_surprisal/item_", as.character(i), ".png")
    ggsave(plot_title, plot = p, width=12, height=5, dpi=320)
  }
}
```

```{r item-surprisal-plots-individual-separate, eval = FALSE}
  dat_plot$WordPosition <- as.numeric(dat_plot$WordPosition)
  summary(dat_plot$WordPosition)
  
  for (i in unique(as.numeric(as.character(dat_plot$Item)))) {
    dat_plot_item <- dat_plot %>% 
      filter(Item == i) %>% 
      group_by(WordPosition) %>%
      mutate(Word = if_else(
        WordPosition == 6,
        paste(unique(Word[WordPosition == 6]), collapse = "/"),
        Word)) %>%
      ungroup() %>% 
      dplyr::rename(Measure_RT = RT,
                    Measure_Gpt2Large = Gpt2Large,
                    Measure_GPTNeo = GPTNeo,
                    Measure_Llama = Llama)
    item_no_char <- as.character(unique(dat_plot_item$Item))
    
    # Rescale surprisal to RTs
    # dat_plot_item <- dat_plot_item %>%
    #   mutate(Surprisal_Gpt2Large_scaled = scales::rescale(Gpt2Large,
    #                                             to = range(RT, na.rm = TRUE))) %>% 
    #   mutate(Surprisal_GPTNeo_scaled = scales::rescale(GPTNeo,
    #                                          to = range(RT, na.rm = TRUE))) %>% 
    #   mutate(Surprisal_Llama_scaled = scales::rescale(Llama,
    #                                         to = range(RT, na.rm = TRUE)))
    
    dat_plot_item_long <- dat_plot_item %>%
      pivot_longer(cols = starts_with("Measure"),
                   names_to = "Measure",
                   values_to = "Value") %>%
      mutate(Measure = recode(Measure,
                          "Measure_RT" = "RT",
                          "Measure_Gpt2Large" = "Gpt2Large",
                          "Measure_GPTNeo" = "GPTNeo",
                          "Measure_Llama" = "Llama"))
    dat_plot_item_long$MeasureType = ifelse(dat_plot_item_long$Measure == "RT",
                                            "RT", "Surprisal")
    
    p <- ggplot(dat_plot_item_long,
                aes(x = WordPosition)) +
      
      geom_line(aes(y = Value,
                    color = ExpCondition,
                    linetype = Task,
                    group = interaction(ExpCondition, Task)),
                linewidth = 1) +
      geom_point(aes(y = Value,
                     color = ExpCondition),
                 size = 2) +
      geom_errorbar(aes(y = Value,
                        color = ExpCondition,
                        ymin = Value - se,
                        ymax = Value + se), 
                    width = 0.2, 
                    linewidth = 0.5) +
      
      facet_wrap(~MeasureType, nrow=2) +
    
      # # Add scaled surprisal lines and points
      # geom_line(aes(y = SurprisalValue, color = Measure),
      #           linewidth = 1, linetype = "solid") +
      # geom_point(aes(y = SurprisalValue, color = Measure), size = 2) +

      {if (as.numeric(item_no_char) < 1000)
           annotate("rect", xmin = 5.5, xmax = 8.5, ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf, 
               fill = "gray", alpha = 0.3)} +
      
      labs(color = "Measure",
           title = paste0("Reading Times: Item ", item_no_char)) +

      scale_x_continuous(
        name = "Word Position",
        breaks = dat_plot_item$WordPosition,
        sec.axis = sec_axis(~ ., name = "Word",
                            breaks = dat_plot_item$WordPosition,
                            labels = dat_plot_item$Word)
      ) +
      
      ylab("Reading Time (ms)") +
      # Secondary Y-Axis
      #scale_y_continuous(sec.axis = sec_axis(~ ., name = "Scaled surprisal")) +

      # Custom color scale for the 3 surprisal measures
      # scale_color_manual(values = c("GPT2-Large" = "gold",
      #                               "GPTNeo" = "orange",
      #                               "Llama" = "darkorange3",
      #                               "High" = "navy",
      #                               "Low" = "steelblue1")) +
      
      scale_color_manual(values = c("navy", "steelblue1")) +
      theme_minimal() +
      theme(
        axis.title.x = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        axis.title.y = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        axis.text.x = element_text(size = 12),
        axis.text.y = element_text(size = 12),
        plot.title = element_text(size = 20, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5),
        legend.title = element_text(size = 14),
        legend.text = element_text(size = 12),
        strip.text = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA)
      )
    
    plot_title <- paste0("./plots/item_plots_surprisal/item_", as.character(i), ".png")
    ggsave(plot_title, plot = p, width=12, height=5, dpi=320)
  }
}
```
